bug.author: cancan101

comments.comment: There also seem to be an entire set of python graph transforms: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/python/tools>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/python/tools</denchmark-link>

The rewrite scripts in python/tools are deprecated in favor of the Graph Transform Tool (and I need to update them to reflect that). In general, we're trying to make as much functionality as possible available across multiple languages, which means implementing core operations in C++ and exposing them through APIs. We're still happy to see user transforms written in Python, we've just chosen to take a different approach for these. Unfortunately that means we don't have 'canonical' examples of writing them in Python, as you've seen.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cancan101>@cancan101</denchmark-link> we'd welcome community contributions in this regard!

The docs for <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/dc6353d12fd41ec869283679dd7766ebff75c520/tensorflow/docs_src/performance/quantization.md>quantization</denchmark-link> should also probably be updated to point to the new graph transform tool.
I am interested in working on this. How do I start?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/petewarden>@petewarden</denchmark-link> is there still work to do here?
Automatically closing due to lack of recent activity. Please update the issue when new information becomes available, and we will reopen the issue. Thanks!
